tenders.title: 704399451-99 - MSS/142 MRO105_CAN
tenders.summary: MRO - Maritime Maintenance, Repair & Overhaul. The Power, Propulsion and Auxiliaies (PPA) Team, which is part of the ships operating centre within Defence Equipment Support (DES) provides global suppo
tenders.detailedDescription: MRO - Maritime Maintenance, Repair & Overhaul. The Power, Propulsion and Auxiliaies (PPA) Team, which is part of the ships operating centre within Defence Equipment Support (DES) provides global support to the Royal Navy. PPA has set up a Framework agreement to provide maintenance, repair and overhaul to Royal Naval Platforms through an established set of suppliers. There is a possibility that during the life of the proposed contract that the size of HM Naval Fleet may increase or decrease. The support contract took the form of a Framework arrangement and has been awarded under DSPCR 2011 regulations. Call-Off contracts were awarded to 16 suppliers via call-off competitions. Mini-Competitions are held throughout the life of the framework agreement. This mini-competition was for the provision of Heating, Ventilation and Air Conditioning items. The awarded call-off contract value was determined subsequent to a competitive exercise undertaken in accordance with the framework terms. The overall framework contract runs to 31 March 2031 and has a maximum value of 317m.The call-off contract value is withheld due to commercial sensitivities and the ongoing competitive nature of the Framework.

tenders.title: 704471450-MSS/143-PD2-029 CAN
tenders.summary: PDaTS - Maritime Post Design and Technical Services. The Power, Propulsion and Auxiliaries (PPA) Team, which is part of the ships operating centre within Defence Equipment Support (DES) provides globa
tenders.detailedDescription: PDaTS - Maritime Post Design and Technical Services. The Power, Propulsion and Auxiliaries (PPA) Team, which is part of the ships operating centre within Defence Equipment Support (DES) provides global support to the Royal Navy. PPA has set up a Framework agreement to provide Post Design and Technical Services to Royal Naval Platforms through an established set of suppliers. There is a possibility that during the life of the proposed contract that the size of HM Naval Fleet may increase or decrease. The support contract took the form of a Framework arrangement and has been awarded under DSPCR 2011 regulations. Call-Off contracts were awarded to 28 suppliers. Mini-Competitions are held throughout the life of the framework agreement. This mini-competition was for the provision of Technical Support Products, Call-off price withheld due to commercial sensitivities and the ongoing competitive nature of the Framework.

tenders.detailedDescription: Prisma Access User Enterprise Edition - includes secure cloud and private application access and outbound internet security (zero trust) for PCC and partners. It covers a premium security subscription with redundant and resilient worldwide service locations including service connections for site-to-site VPN connections and ZTNA connectors. It also login retention for audit and compliance and includes the Secure Enterprise Browser for Internet and private app access from non-PCC devices. The platform also provides a Management Console for administration, configuration and reporting purposes.

tenders.title: 704399451-39 - MSS/142 MRO049_CAN
tenders.summary: MRO - Maritime Maintenance, Repair & Overhaul. The Power, Propulsion and Auxiliaies (PPA) Team, which is part of the ships operating centre within Defence Equipment Support (DES) provides global suppo
tenders.detailedDescription: MRO - Maritime Maintenance, Repair & Overhaul. The Power, Propulsion and Auxiliaies (PPA) Team, which is part of the ships operating centre within Defence Equipment Support (DES) provides global support to the Royal Navy. PPA has set up a Framework agreement to provide maintenance, repair and overhaul to Royal Naval Platforms through an established set of suppliers. There is a possibility that during the life of the proposed contract that the size of HM Naval Fleet may increase or decrease. The support contract took the form of a Framework arrangement and has been awarded under DSPCR 2011 regulations. Call-Off contracts were awarded to 16 suppliers via call-off competitions. Mini-Competitions are held throughout the life of the framework agreement. This mini-competition was for the provision of Electrical, Power and Distribution items. The awarded call-off contract value was determined subsequent to a competitive exercise undertaken in accordance with the framework terms. The overall framework contract runs to 31 March 2031 and has a maximum value of 317m.The call-off contract value is withheld due to commercial sensitivities and the ongoing competitive nature of the Framework.

tenders.title: NHSE NE&Y End Point Assessment Organisation (Pearson)
tenders.summary: The NHS England, North East & Yorkshire, Education Investments and Commissioning team hold a government (Education, Skills Funding Agency) contract to deliver apprenticeships to NHS employers for nich
tenders.detailedDescription: The NHS England, North East & Yorkshire, Education Investments and Commissioning team hold a government (Education, Skills Funding Agency) contract to deliver apprenticeships to NHS employers for niche apprenticeship programmes not available elsewhere. For all apprenticeships, there is an End Point Assessment (EPA) element mandated at the end of training. This must be carried out by an independent organization to assess the apprentice has met all the criteria of the apprenticeship standard and can certify them as complete. To become an End Point Assessment Organization (EPAO), an organization must become registered on the Department for Education's official 'Apprenticeship Provider and Assessment Register'

tenders.title: DHSC: SC&I: Design for Life Decontamination Capacity Survey.v2
tenders.organization: Department of Health and Social Care (DHSC)
tenders.summary: Design for Life is the Government's programme to build a circular economy for medical products by 2045, delivering increased resilience, economic growth, value for money and sustainability. The progra
tenders.detailedDescription: Design for Life is the Government's programme to build a circular economy for medical products by 2045, delivering increased resilience, economic growth, value for money and sustainability. The programme published its Design for Life roadmap in October 2024, setting out six key barriers ('problem statements') to achieving this vision and a path of 30 actions to overcome them. This project delivers against the 'Physical and digital infrastructure' problem statement and specifically Action 19 to 'survey existing systems' for decontamination.

tenders.title: Flood Hydrology Improvement Programme (FHIP), Project D5.2
tenders.summary: The requirement for this project phase is to deliver a proof of concept that explores how uncertainty in river level, river flow, and rain gauge data can be quantified and communicated prior to its us
tenders.detailedDescription: The requirement for this project phase is to deliver a proof of concept that explores how uncertainty in river level, river flow, and rain gauge data can be quantified and communicated prior to its use in hydrological models. The long-term ambition is to develop methods applicable across the full hydrological range, however this phase anticipates focusing on high flows and rainfall only, aligning with FHIP funding availability and its flood-related objectives.

tenders.title: 704399451-64 - MSS/142 MRO074_CAN
tenders.summary: MRO - Maritime Maintenance, Repair & Overhaul. The Power, Propulsion and Auxiliaies (PPA) Team, which is part of the ships operating centre within Defence Equipment Support (DES) provides global suppo
tenders.detailedDescription: MRO - Maritime Maintenance, Repair & Overhaul. The Power, Propulsion and Auxiliaies (PPA) Team, which is part of the ships operating centre within Defence Equipment Support (DES) provides global support to the Royal Navy. PPA has set up a Framework agreement to provide maintenance, repair and overhaul to Royal Naval Platforms through an established set of suppliers. There is a possibility that during the life of the proposed contract that the size of HM Naval Fleet may increase or decrease. The support contract took the form of a Framework arrangement and has been awarded under DSPCR 2011 regulations. Call-Off contracts were awarded to 16 suppliers via call-off competitions. Mini-Competitions are held throughout the life of the framework agreement. This mini-competition was for the provision of mechanical system items. The awarded call-off contract value was determined subsequent to a competitive exercise undertaken in accordance with the framework terms. The overall framework contract runs to 31 March 2031 and has a maximum value of 317m.The call-off contract value is withheld due to commercial sensitivities and the ongoing competitive nature of the Framework.

tenders.detailedDescription: PDaTS - Maritime Post Design and Technical Services. The Power, Propulsion and Auxiliaries (PPA) Team, which is part of the ships operating centre within Defence Equipment Support (DES) provides global support to the Royal Navy. PPA has set up a Framework agreement to provide Post Design and Technical Services to Royal Naval Platforms through an established set of suppliers. There is a possibility that during the life of the proposed contract that the size of HM Naval Fleet may increase or decrease. The support contract took the form of a Framework arrangement and has been awarded under DSPCR 2011 regulations. Call-Off contracts were awarded to 28 suppliers. Mini-Competitions are held throughout the life of the framework agreement. This mini-competition was for the provision of Technical Support Products, Call-off price withheld due to commercial sensitivities and the ongoing competitive nature of the Framework.

tenders.detailedDescription: Non Invasive Prenatal Testing (NIPT) service based at St George's University Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust, screening for Down's, Edwards' and Patau's syndromes, in line with UK National Screening Committee (UKNSC) recommendations and NHS England requirements. In some instances, fetal sexing is performed in addition to the main trisomy's. The SAFE test has been set up as a collaboration between the Fetal Medicine Unit and the St George's Genomics Service, which is a UKAS accredited medical laboratory. The service provides NIPT to approximately one third of the NHS maternity services in England and several private clinical services

tenders.title: Toxicology Services
tenders.summary: Where there are concerns about a registrant's physical or mental health, we may require the registrant to undergo a health assessment. This may form one part of a wider investigation into a registrant
tenders.detailedDescription: Where there are concerns about a registrant's physical or mental health, we may require the registrant to undergo a health assessment. This may form one part of a wider investigation into a registrant's fitness to practise. At the end of an investigation, a registrant may enter into a period of medical supervision to monitor their health condition and compliance with any restrictions on their registration. Toxicology testing is required as part of the GMC's Fitness to Practise proceedings in order to establish:a) if and what substances have been/are being used by the registrant (this is of particular help in health assessments)b) if the registrant has complied with undertakings or conditions (which is of particular help for the purposes of medical supervision).This is mostly done using blood, in particular PEth testing, and hair testing at present, although nail, saliva, urine and breath tests can be carried out at the GMC's discretion.

tenders.title: DfT - Crisis Response and Resilience Digital Twin (CRDT)
tenders.summary: This project aims to procure an analytical platform, that is robust, scalable, user-friendly and capable of combining methods across analytical disciplines to improve the DfT's Crisis Response and Res
tenders.detailedDescription: This project aims to procure an analytical platform, that is robust, scalable, user-friendly and capable of combining methods across analytical disciplines to improve the DfT's Crisis Response and Resilience capabilities. Recognising the rapid pace of change in technology and the range of possible technological methodologies, DfT is using an outcomes-based approach to enable innovation and use of novel data and technologies. The aim of this work is to create a national platform capable of identifying disruptions across transport modes in a timely fashion and appropriate level of detail, combining a variety of data sources, estimate and inform users of their likely impact to people and goods, track developments, model potential interventions and gather learnings for future use.

tenders.summary: Insight Multi Academy Trust, on behalf of Sir Graham Balfour School, intends to publish a procurement opportunity for the provision of integrated facilities management services. This PIN is issued to
tenders.detailedDescription: Insight Multi Academy Trust, on behalf of Sir Graham Balfour School, intends to publish a procurement opportunity for the provision of integrated facilities management services. This PIN is issued to inform the market and invite early engagement prior to the release of the Contract Notice. The current PFI contract will terminate on 31 December 2026. The school seeks a provider capable of supporting the transition from a PFI arrangement to an IFM solution. The successful provider will be expected to deploy modern technology, robust reporting, and effective contract management to deliver a high-quality, efficient service.

tenders.title: Demand Responsive Transport
tenders.summary: North Lincolnshire Council (the Authority) is seeking tenders for the provision of vehicle operations in support of its Demand Responsive Transport (DRT) Service. The Authority is seeking to appoint a
tenders.detailedDescription: North Lincolnshire Council (the Authority) is seeking tenders for the provision of vehicle operations in support of its Demand Responsive Transport (DRT) Service. The Authority is seeking to appoint a suitable Provider to support the Authority in achieving the key council outcome of Connected, which is the ability for the population of North Lincolnshire to be able to access employment, education, social and leisure opportunities regardless of where they live.  The aim is to provide suitable coverage of DRT across the Authority that provides key connections primarily but not exclusively to and from isolated rural areas. Where possible the ability to encourage modal shift from single occupancy car journeys in particular also needs to be promoted.

tenders.summary: PDaTS - Maritime Post Design and Technical Services. The Power, Propulsion and Auxiliaries (PPA) Team, which is part of the ships operating centre within Defence Equipment Support (DES) provides globa
tenders.detailedDescription: PDaTS - Maritime Post Design and Technical Services. The Power, Propulsion and Auxiliaries (PPA) Team, which is part of the ships operating centre within Defence Equipment Support (DES) provides global support to the Royal Navy. PPA has set up a Framework agreement to provide Post Design and Technical Services to Royal Naval Platforms through an established set of suppliers. There is a possibility that during the life of the proposed contract that the size of HM Naval Fleet may increase or decrease. The support contract took the form of a Framework arrangement and has been awarded under DSPCR 2011 regulations. Call-Off contracts were awarded to 28 suppliers. Mini-Competitions are held throughout the life of the framework agreement. This mini-competition was for the provision of Technical Support Products, Call-off price withheld due to commercial sensitivities and the ongoing competitive nature of the Framework.

tenders.summary: MRO - Maritime Maintenance, Repair & Overhaul. The Power, Propulsion and Auxiliaies (PPA) Team, which is part of the ships operating centre within Defence Equipment Support (DES) provides global suppo
tenders.detailedDescription: MRO - Maritime Maintenance, Repair & Overhaul. The Power, Propulsion and Auxiliaies (PPA) Team, which is part of the ships operating centre within Defence Equipment Support (DES) provides global support to the Royal Navy. PPA has set up a Framework agreement to provide maintenance, repair and overhaul to Royal Naval Platforms through an established set of suppliers. There is a possibility that during the life of the proposed contract that the size of HM Naval Fleet may increase or decrease. The support contract took the form of a Framework arrangement and has been awarded under DSPCR 2011 regulations. Call-Off contracts were awarded to 16 suppliers via call-off competitions. Mini-Competitions are held throughout the life of the framework agreement. This mini-competition was for the provision of Marine Electrical, Power and Distribution items. The awarded call-off contract value was determined subsequent to a competitive exercise undertaken in accordance with the framework terms. The overall framework contract runs to 31 March 2031 and has a maximum value of 317m.The call-off contract value is withheld due to commercial sensitivities and the ongoing competitive nature of the Framework.

tenders.title: Clinical database National Haemoglobinopathy Registry
tenders.summary: Specialised Commissioning historically funded a small number of clinical registries and audits related to specialised services, with arrangements predating NHS England. After 2013, NHSE became respons
tenders.detailedDescription: Specialised Commissioning historically funded a small number of clinical registries and audits related to specialised services, with arrangements predating NHS England. After 2013, NHSE became responsible for several of these databases, though oversight remained regional until 2018/19. To strengthen governance and strategic direction, funding has since been centralised nationally. As these registries are essential for specialised commissioning- holding unique clinical data and supporting service identification-approval is sought to extend current funding arrangements for 18 months to ensure continuity and stability.

The Power, Propulsion and Auxiliaries (PPA) Team, which is part of the ships operating centre within Defence Equipment Support (DES) provides global support to the Royal Navy. PPA has set up a Framework agreement to provide Post Design and Technical Services to Royal Naval Platforms through an established set of suppliers. There is a possibility that during the life of the proposed contract that the size of HM Naval Fleet may increase or decrease. The support contract took the form of a Framework arrangement and has been awarded under DSPCR 2011 regulations. Call-Off contracts were awarded to 28 suppliers. Mini-Competitions are held throughout the life of the framework agreement. This mini-competition was for the provision of Safety and Environmental Support Activity, Call-off price withheld due to commercial sensitivities and the ongoing competitive nature of the Framework.

tenders.detailedDescription: The project focuses on the modernisation of key areas of Coalville Library, including a full redesign of the children's area with flexible furniture, updated shelving, improved seating, and a sensory space. The foyer and counter area will be reconfigured to create a more accessible and welcoming entrance. The main library space will receive new flooring, shelving, seating, and display areas, with an option to update the PC zone. Exterior works will enhance the building faade to improve visibility and overall appeal.

tenders.detailedDescription: National Highways want to trial the Miyawaki method of tree planting to determine whether it's a more successful and more climate resilient method of tree establishment when compared to traditional methods. tenders.detailedDescription: he North East Lincolnshire Highways Framework will expire on 31st May 2026. The Authority is planning to procure a new Highways Framework for capital works, minor civils work, Civil structural works, surface dressing, road marking road signing, carriageway surfacing and traffic management. tenders.detailedDescription: This DPD follows a feasibility study completed in July 2024 under the Greater London Authority's (GLA) Local Energy Accelerator, which identified strong potential for a clean heat network. The Bayonne area is well-positioned for future expansion, including links to a strategic Hammersmith Town Centre network outlined in the Cross Borough Energy Masterplan, building on the successful delivery of the Civic Campus heat network. The area also lies within a designated Heat Network Priority Area in the London Plan.

tenders.detailedDescription: A full Flat Roof Replacement at Kirkstone Lodge, Summerwood Road, Isleworth TW7 7QJ. Following an inspection 30 September 2024, there is evidence that the roof covering was no longer watertight. Water ingress was observed beneath the primary roof layer. Repair is not a suitable solution, and we need to install a new Langley Roofing system installation to ensure watertightness and receive a 30 year insurance backed guarantee.

tenders.title: S30063 UPS Battery Rollout on Smart Motorways
tenders.summary: The Power Outages Project is being commissioned by Operational Control Division to increase resilience of Technology on Smart Motorways, by reducing the impact of Power Outages. This phase of work is
tenders.detailedDescription: The Power Outages Project is being commissioned by Operational Control Division to increase resilience of Technology on Smart Motorways, by reducing the impact of Power Outages. This phase of work is introducing UPS Systems (consisting of Inverter and Lithium Ion Batteries) to support Operational Technology, with the aim of providing an average of 6 hours resilience against Power Outages. As UPS Systems were not included within the original design of Smart Motorways, the CMDB and DMRB/MCHW will need to be updated to include the option of UPS to support the power supply where it is deemed appropriate. Furthermore, a new product specification is required for the Cabinets to house the new UPS Inverters, Batteries and ancillary equipment. This Work Order aims to onboard a service provider to make the relevant document updates, drive these through governance to final approval and contribute to the strategic decisions from a Safety and Engineering Standards perspective that are required to deliver the project.

tenders.summary: This contract is for a supplier to deliver a comprehensive Audio-Visual Technology Refresh for Ofgem within the Arena meeting space located in 10SC London, ensuring alignment with rapid technological
tenders.detailedDescription: This contract is for a supplier to deliver a comprehensive Audio-Visual Technology Refresh for Ofgem within the Arena meeting space located in 10SC London, ensuring alignment with rapid technological advancements and enabling improved ways of working. tenders.title: Social Media monitoring tool
tenders.organization: Office of Qualifications and Examinations Regulation (Ofqual)
tenders.summary: 1.2.3.	Ofqual communications are seeking a comprehensive social and media monitoring platform that combines three core capabilities: social media management (including listening across major platforms
tenders.detailedDescription: 1.2.3.	Ofqual communications are seeking a comprehensive social and media monitoring platform that combines three core capabilities: social media management (including listening across major platforms and forums with sentiment analysis, crisis alerts, content scheduling and publishing and performance analytics), 24/7 media monitoring (providing immediate alerts and cuttings from all national, regional, local and broadcast media, including full access to paywalled publications), and media management tools (with up-to-date journalist databases, distribution list functionality and detailed analytics covering sentiment, reach and share of voice). The solution must include a dedicated account manager and training, provide both historical data access for year-on-year comparisons, have the ability to generate visual reports, all whilst maintaining reliable service standards.

tenders.summary: LGPS members are currently permitted to contribute to a standard AVC scheme and receive Income Tax relief on their contributions. AVCs are a long-term pension savings plan that runs alongside the main
tenders.detailedDescription: LGPS members are currently permitted to contribute to a standard AVC scheme and receive Income Tax relief on their contributions. AVCs are a long-term pension savings plan that runs alongside the main LGPS scheme and allows members to build up a 100% tax free capital sum. On retirement, they can access the benefits through a range of options including the ability to receive the lump sum in most cases.

tenders.title: 24/019 Holloway Lodge Roof Repairs & Tree Root Removal - AWARD
tenders.summary: Tamworth Council is looking for a suitably qualified and experienced builder with proven experience of working on Scheduled Monuments or Listed Buildings to undertake roofing repair works to Holloway
tenders.detailedDescription: Tamworth Council is looking for a suitably qualified and experienced builder with proven experience of working on Scheduled Monuments or Listed Buildings to undertake roofing repair works to Holloway Lodge and a tree stump removal near a Grade II listed building and wall. Holloway Lodge is a Grade II listed lodge dating from 1810 and serves as the gatehouse for the south western entrance to Tamworth Castle grounds (Staffordshire B79 7NB).  It is located within the context of Tamworth Castle which is a Grade I listed building. The castle and grounds are also a Registered Scheduled Monument. As such alterations to the fabric are subject to listed building consent and works within the boundary of the Schedule Monument are also subject to Scheduled Monument Consent.

tenders.title: Video Analytics
tenders.summary: The Police & Crime Commissioner for Warwickshire on behalf of Warwickshire Police has awarded a contract for a number of video analytics software licences to check and analyse CCTV image evidence, a p
tenders.detailedDescription: The Police & Crime Commissioner for Warwickshire on behalf of Warwickshire Police has awarded a contract for a number of video analytics software licences to check and analyse CCTV image evidence, a process that is currently undertaken manually by an investigator, therefore the use of the software will free up crucial investigative hours.  This was a direct award via Crown Commercial Services G Cloud 14 framework reference RM1557.14 Lot 3 Cloud Support, meaning the contract is compliant with PCRs 2015.  The contract is for an initial period of 12 months with the option to extend for a further 12 months at the authority's discretion. The annual value is 22,000 plus VAT.
